meanings.sent1: The tree in our backyard has a rooty base that keeps it stable in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The garden soil felt rooty as I dug my hands into it.
meanings.sent3: The rooty vines in the forest seemed to be playing a game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her family history was deeply rooty, with connections stretching back for generations.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a musty, rooty smell that reminded me of my childhood adventures.

meanings.definition: Full of roots or root-like structures.
meanings.sent1: The rooty ground made it difficult to walk through the dense forest.
meanings.sent2: The tangled mess of rooty branches made it hard to untangle the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The rooty tangle in the garden looked like a messy puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a rooty maze, twisting and turning with no clear path forward.
meanings.sent5: The rooty texture of the fabric reminded me of the rough bark of a tree.
